Course.name: STEEL-R RIDE Team Exemplar
Course.description:
This course is designed to provide an example of the GIFT/RIDE Integration with a team of connected users.

This course contains a real-time assessment built for the "React to Fire (Forest)" scenario in RIDE.

The assessment contains four playable team members, four non-playable enemy team members, and an OC/T non-playable team member. Your team will be assessed on a React to Contact task.

The real-time assessment will end 10 seconds after all enemies are eliminated.

message.content:
Welcome to the STEEL-R RIDE Team Exemplar GIFT Course.


This course is designed to accompany the GIFT 2022-1 Official Release.  The RIDE application provides a readily available environment to develop and test ongoing research across game engines. In this instance, RIDE, the Rapid Integration & Development Environment developed by the USC Institute for Creative Technologies (ICT) (https://ride.ict.usc.edu/), is built upon the Unity game engine. GIFT integrates with RIDE through the GIFT Gateway module.


The intention of this course is to showcase new features to the GIFT community. You will be presented with a slideshow that covers these new features in detail after your experience in the training application. More information on GIFT features can also be found in the link above.

This course is designed for use with a team, and allows for up to four learners to participate at once. They will be able to see each other take actions, and the course contains a task which will assess group performance as a whole.


During this course, you will interact with the RIDE Training Application course object. Please refer to this GIFT Wiki page for important runtime instructions, keyboard controls and general RIDE information. We highly recommended that you have access to this page while interacting with RIDE. 


GIFT will also provide instructions throughout the course via feedback text that will be displayed in the GIFT webpage window. 


Please press the continue arrow when you are ready to begin.

The Game Master tab will allow you to view assessment data and a map of entities while the scenario progresses.

If you are on the computer that is running an instance of GIFT, you can use the following instructions to access the Game Master tab.

To access the Game Master tab:

  1. Open the system tray in the corner of the Windows Start menu.
  2. Right-click the GIFT icon.
  3. Left-click the "Open GIFT Webpage" option. A new tab will appear with the GIFT login screen.
  4. Log into that tab with the same credentials you used to log into GIFT.
  5. Left-click "Game Master" on the GIFT page. A dropdown menu will appear.
  6. Left-click "Active Session" from the Game Master dropdown menu.
  7. A screen will appear which says that "There are no sessions currently active."
  8. When the RIDe course object begins, the Game Master screen will show a new session called "STE RIDE Team Exemplar". Left-click that to open and display the Game Master map.
    NOTE: You will know that the RIDE course object begins when the GIFT webpage window shows two mostly empty green panes, with the leftmost pane displaying textual feedback.

Before starting the training application: 

  • On the next screen you will be asked to either Host or Join a networked session. If you are running GIFT on this computer, press the 'HOST' button. 
  • Next, select a role from the team organization on the left side of the screen.

NOTE: It is important to remember which role you assign here - you will need to select the same role in the RIDE training application on the next screen.


Before clicking 'START SESSION' in GIFT, the RIDE scenario session in the training application needs to be active in order to open the gateway connection for GIFT.

To activate a session in RIDE, follow these steps:

  1. Double-click the RIDE executable at <RIDE Install Location>/STEELR RIDE Trainer.exe
    NOTE:     ﻿<RIDE Install Location> is the location that you extracted RIDE to in the "Set Up Your Machine for RIDE" course.
  2. A grassy landscape will appear, with a menu in the top left of the window.
  3. The top text box contains a user name. If the default name is not the one you used to log into GIFT, replace that user name with your GIFT user name.
  4. If you are running the Host computer, Click "Start Host".
  5. If you are not running the Host, type the Host's IP address into the IP address text box, and click "Connect Client".
  6. Choose your role from the "Role" drop-down.
    NOTE:     It is important to remember which role you assign here - you will need to select the same role in the RIDE training application on the next screen.

  7. Click "Spawn" under the "Role" drop-down to spawn an entity with that role.
  8. Press the forward arrow in the GIFT web page window to move onto the next course object.

Soon, you will be starting a GIFT session. Before you continue, keep the following in mind.

  • If a session is not being hosted in the RIDE you will receive an error in GIFT after attempting to start the GIFT networked session. If an error occurs, please click Disconnect in the RIDE application and retake this course.
  • Make sure to have the GIFT web page window in view at all times while using the RIDE application.

  • Please read all feedback and instructions carefully throughout the course. 
  • Enemies are located near the trees in the forest, and wear a green uniform.
  • NOTE: The enemies are firing in the direction of the non-playable teammate standing under the number "1" indicator. If you stand in between this teammate and your enemies, you may be shot, which can cause the scenario to end early. Stay outside the enemy line of fire.

When you are ready to continue, follow these steps:

  1. Press the forward arrow in the GIFT web page window to move onto the next course object.

When the scenario begins, you will be instructed to move as a team to a designated location.

Once you reach the designated location, you will be assessed in the following six areas:

  1. Maintaining Assigned Sectors of Fire
  2. Detecting Enemy Targets
  3. Maintaining Proper Rate of Fire
  4. Avoiding Muzzle Flagging
  5. Engaging Targets with Well-Aimed Fire
  6. Eliminating All Enemies

Most assessments will occur a few seconds after you begin, but in order to trigger a full assessment of "Maintaining Proper Rate of Fire," try to fire your weapons at a constant rate NEAR the enemies for at least 10 seconds without hitting them. You will receive feedback in this window that will tell you how you are performing in this assessment.


When you are ready to continue, follow these steps:

  1. Ensure that all learners are connected and have spawned their entity before continuing.
  2. Only after all learners are connected and have spawned an entity, In RIDE, press 'Begin'.
    NOTE:     If a learner spawns an entity after 'Begin' is pressed, its data will not be sent to GIFT. Press 'Begin' again to fix this.
  3. Press the forward arrow in the GIFT web page window to move onto the next course object.

You have completed the RIDE scenario.

Make sure to disconnect RIDE.

  1. Click the "Disconnect" button in the top left of the RIDE window.
    NOTE: When the host disconnects, all clients will automatically disconnect.

  2. Press the forward arrow in the GIFT web page window to move onto the next course object.

You can now use Game Master to view recordings of past sessions.

To view the previous session in Game Master:

  1. Open the Game Master tab that was opened earlier in this course.
  2. Left-click "Game Master" in the menu to open the dropdown menu.
  3. From the dropdown menu, left-click "Past Sessions".
  4. Any sessions you have run in GIFT should be listed. Certain selected sessions may be marked as favorites with a highlighted star. These will be at the top of the list.
    You can click an un-highlighted star to mark its course as a favorite for later reference.

  5. Left-click the most recent session, called "STEEL-R RIDE Team Exemplar", to view the session that you just finished.
    The most recent session may be underneath highlighted courses, if any were marked as favorite before running this course.
  6. Left-click the Play button to begin playback of the recording.

You can view other Past Session logs as well.

Follow the steps above, except for step 5, where you left-click on the session of your choice. This can also be used to view the premade demonstration logs, which are marked as favorite by default.

media.name: Thank you
media.message: This slide show briefly describes the conditions used in this course, and gives examples of how they might be used in general.

message.content:
Thank you for your participation in the STEEL-R RIDE Team Exemplar course. 

  • GIFT can integrate with external applications to process data and assess learner behavior.
  • GIFT can track the actions of multiple users logged into the same course, participating in the same
  • The Game Master allows this data to be recorded and played back later.
  • ﻿GIFT's conditions can be used to assess team behavior as a whole, in addition to individual behavior.
When re-running this course, try taking actions that would change your output in Game Master, such as looking away from enemies or firing at a different rate.

Press the continue arrow to end the course.
